ground_truth: He strides to the elevator and presses the Call button. He presses his earpiece and enters the elevator. As he exits, he hears two other colleagues, Holden and Matthews, with Taylor. Barnes strides past them. Taylor follows him to a car. They all move to cars as President Ashton emerges from the elevator. The President gets into the car by which Barnes and Taylor are standing. They follow him in. The convoy, headed by the two motorcycles, sets off from the underground garage. Behind the motorcycles is a police car, then two four-by-fours with their tailgates open. Then two stretch limos with more vehicles bringing up the rear. Armed police line the route. Armed men in uniform are on rooftops and behind barred gates. In the Presidential limo, Taylor grins. Protesters grow rowdy as the motorcade passes them. The convoy stops by a statue of Pizarro at Spain. The Secret Service agents spill out. His car door is opened. Taylor and Barnes climb up. Barnes scowls as he scans the press photographers. His narrow face is permanently grim as he turns from the cameras and walks around the car to join Taylor and the President. Taylor and Barnes lead the way. The President is behind them. Holden and Matthews bring up the rear. Taylor glances across at Barnes as the group makes their way to the plaza. They emerge through an archway of the crowded plaza. The President strides towards a child in its mother's arms. He shakes the baby's hand. He greets the flag-waving crowd, grasping hands as he passes. Barnes spots a man wearing dark glasses slip his hand into an inside pocket. The man's camera drops to the ground. The presidential party continues, Holden replacing Barnes at the front. Barnes now behind the President. Two soldiers on the roof. President Ashton climbs red-carpeted steps onto a podium placed in the middle of the plaza, which is filled with a flag-waving, cheering crowd free from protesters. The balding man now walks to a lectern. Barnes and Taylor stride across the podium and stand facing out towards the sea of yellow and red flags. Standing amongst the crowd is a chunky man in a blue and white checked shirt. He holds a video camera. Barnes notices a curtain twitch on an upper floor. Taylor follows Barnes' gaze. Barnes goes to speak into a mic in his cuff, but stops. Barnes' eyes are fixed on the window and the curtain. He speaks into his mic. Taylor and Barnes exchange a look. Barnes sees the man in the checked shirt pointing his camera at the upper floors behind him to where Barnes saw the fluttering curtain. The man turns back around checking his camera.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution

Barnes strides past them. Taylor follows him to a vehicle. They all move to vehicles as President Ashton emerges from the lift. The President gets into the vehicle by which Barnes and Taylor are standing. They follow him in. The convoy, headed by the two motorcycles, sets off from the subterranean garage. Behind the motorcycles is a squad car, then two four-by-fours with their tailgates open. Then two stretch limos with more vehicles bringing up the rear. Armed police line the path. Armed men in uniform are on rooftops and behind barred gates. In the Presidential limo, Taylor grins. Demonstrators grow rowdy as the procession passes them. The convoy stops by a figure of Pizarro at Spain. The Secret Service agents spill out. His vehicle door is opened. Taylor and Barnes climb up. Barnes scowls as he scans the press photographers. His narrow visage is permanently grim as he turns from the cameras and walks around the vehicle to join Taylor and the President. Taylor and Barnes lead the way. The President is behind them. Holden and Matthews bring up the rear. Taylor glances across at Barnes as the group makes their way to the plaza. They emerge through an archway of the crowded plaza. The President strides towards a child in its mother's arms. He shakes the baby's hand. He greets the flag-waving crowd, grasping hands as he passes. Barnes spots a man wearing dark spectacles slip his hand into an inner pocket. The man's camera drops to the ground. The presidential party continues, Holden replacing Barnes at the front. Barnes now behind the President. Two soldiers on the roof. President Ashton climbs red-carpeted steps onto a podium placed in the middle of the plaza, which is filled with a flag-waving, cheering crowd free from demonstrators. The balding man now walks to a lectern. Barnes and Taylor stride across the podium and stand facing out towards the sea of yellow and red flags. Standing amongst the crowd is a chunky man in a blue and white checked shirt. He holds a video camera. Barnes notices a curtain twitch on an upper floor. Taylor follows Barnes' gaze. Barnes goes to speak into a mic in his cuff but stops. Barnes' eyes are fixed on the window and the curtain. He speaks into his mic. Taylor and Barnes exchange a look. Barnes sees the man in the checked shirt pointing his camera at the upper floors behind him to where Barnes saw the fluttering curtain. The man turns back around checking his camera.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The elevator is approached by him, and the Call button is pressed. His earpiece is pressed by him as the elevator is entered. As he exits, two other colleagues, Holden and Matthews, are heard with Taylor. They are strode past by Barnes. He is followed by Taylor to a car. The cars are all moved to by them as President Ashton emerges from the elevator. The car is entered by the President, where Barnes and Taylor stand. He is followed in by them. The convoy, with two motorcycles heading it, is set off from the underground garage. A police car follows the motorcycles, then two four-by-fours with their tailgates open. Two stretch limos follow, with more vehicles bringing up the rear. The route is lined by armed police. On rooftops and behind barred gates are armed men in uniform. In the Presidential limo, a grin is given by Taylor. As the motorcade passes, the protesters are rowdied. The convoy is stopped by a statue of Pizarro at Spain. The Secret Service agents spill out. His car door is opened by someone. Taylor and Barnes climb up. As he scans the press photographers, a scowl is given by Barnes. His narrow face grimly turns from the cameras and around the car to join Taylor and the President. The way is led by Taylor and Barnes. They are followed by the President. The rear is brought up by Holden and Matthews. Barnes is glanced at by Taylor as the group makes their way to the plaza. Through an archway of the crowded plaza, they emerge. A child in its mother's arms is approached by the President. The baby's hand is shaken by him. The flag-waving crowd is greeted by him, grasping hands as he passes. A man wearing dark glasses is spotted by Barnes slipping his hand into an inside pocket. The man's camera is dropped to the ground. The presidential party continues, with Barnes replaced at the front by Holden. The President is now in front of Barnes. Two soldiers are spotted on the roof. Red-carpeted steps are climbed by President Ashton onto a podium placed in the middle of the plaza, which is filled with a flag-waving, cheering crowd free from protesters. A lectern is now walked to by the balding man. The podium is strode across by Barnes and Taylor, who stand facing out towards the sea of yellow and red flags. Amongst the crowd stands a chunky man in a blue and white checked shirt. A video camera is held by him. A curtain is noticed by Barnes twitching on an upper floor. Barnes' gaze is followed by Taylor. Barnes goes to speak into a mic in his cuff but stops. His eyes are fixed on the window and the curtain by Barnes. His mic is spoken into by him. A look is exchanged between Taylor and Barnes. The man in the checked shirt is seen by Barnes pointing his camera at the upper floors behind him, to where the fluttering curtain was seen by Barnes. The man turns back around, checking his camera.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He strides to the elevator, presses the Call button, and adjusts his earpiece as he enters. On exiting, he passes colleagues Holden and Matthews with Taylor. Taylor follows him to a car. As President Ashton emerges from the elevator, everyone moves to cars. The President enters the vehicle with Barnes and Taylor, who follow him in. The convoy, led by motorcycles, leaves the underground garage. A police car and two open-tailgate four-by-fours precede two stretch limos with more vehicles. Armed police line the route, and armed men are on rooftops and behind gates. In the Presidential limo, Taylor grins while protesters grow rowdy. The convoy halts by a statue of Pizarro in Spain. Secret Service agents exit. Taylor and Barnes ascend as Barnes scowls, scanning the press photographers. His face remains grim as he joins Taylor and the President. Taylor and Barnes lead, followed by the President, with Holden and Matthews at the rear. Taylor glances at Barnes as they proceed to the plaza, emerging through a crowded archway. The President greets a baby and flag-waving crowd. Barnes spots a man in dark glasses reaching into his pocket, dropping his camera. The presidential party continues, with Holden replacing Barnes at the front. Barnes is now behind the President. President Ashton ascends red-carpeted steps to a podium amidst a cheering, flag-waving crowd. A balding man approaches a lectern. Barnes and Taylor stand on the podium, facing yellow and red flags. Among the crowd is a chunky man in a checked shirt with a video camera. Barnes notices a curtain twitch on an upper floor, which Taylor also observes. Barnes stops himself from speaking into his mic, eyes fixed on the window. He then speaks into his mic, and Taylor and Barnes exchange a look. Barnes observes the man with the camera turning to film the upper floors where the curtain moved, before turning back to check his footage.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: He reaches the elevator, presses the Call button, and enters with an earpiece on. Exiting, he passes Holden, Matthews, and Taylor, who follows him. As President Ashton exits the elevator, Barnes and Taylor stand by the car the President enters and follow him. The convoy, led by motorcycles, police car, and four-by-fours, leaves the garage. Armed police and men on rooftops line the route. In the limo, Taylor grins at protesters as the motorcade stops at a statue in Spain. Secret Service agents exit. Barnes scowls, scanning photographers before joining Taylor and the President. Barnes and Taylor lead, with Holden and Matthews behind. They reach the crowded plaza; the President greets a child and crowd. Barnes spots a man drop his camera. The entourage continues, Barnes behind the President, now with two soldiers on the roof. Ashton climbs onto a podium in the cheering crowd. A balding man approaches the lectern, Barnes notices a checked-shirt man with a video camera, and a curtain twitching. Barnes speaks into his mic, exchanging looks with Taylor, while noting the man aiming his camera upstairs.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He confidently strides over to the elevator and decisively presses the Call button to summon it. With a quick tap on his earpiece, he enters the elevator. As he makes his way out of the elevator, he hears the familiar voices of his colleagues, Holden and Matthews, who are accompanied by Taylor. Without pausing, Barnes strides purposefully past them. Taylor, however, promptly follows him and together they head towards a waiting car. Shortly thereafter, they all proceed to the assembled cars as President Ashton emerges from the elevator himself. The President approaches and enters the car where Barnes and Taylor stand dutifully. They follow him into the vehicle, joining him inside. The convoy, led by two roaring motorcycles, begins its journey from the underground garage. Trailing right behind the motorcycles is a police car, followed by two rugged four-by-fours with their tailgates conspicuously open. Then, two sleek stretch limousines follow closely, with additional vehicles bringing up the rear of the procession. Along the designated route, armed police officers vigilantly line the way, while other armed men in uniform are strategically positioned on rooftops and behind sturdy barred gates. Inside the presidential limousine, Taylor flashes a grin. Outside, protesters display growing rowdiness as the motorcade rolls past them. The convoy comes to a halt next to a prominent statue of Pizarro located in Spain. At this point, Secret Service agents efficiently spill out of the vehicles. When the car door is opened, Taylor and Barnes step out. With a scowl on his narrow, permanently grim face, Barnes scans the eager press photographers. He deliberately turns away from the cameras, walking around the car to rejoin Taylor and the President. With determination, Taylor and Barnes lead the way, with the President trailing behind them. Holden and Matthews close the formation, bringing up the rear. As they progress towards the plaza, Taylor glances sideways at Barnes. The group emerges through an archway into the lively, crowded plaza. The President confidently strides towards a mother holding her child and shakes the baby's little hand. He acknowledges the enthusiastic flag-waving crowd, warmly grasping hands as he proceeds. Barnes spots a suspicious man wearing dark glasses, who slyly slips his hand into an inside pocket. Suddenly, the man's camera tumbles to the ground. The presidential party continues on their path, with Holden seamlessly replacing Barnes at the forefront. Barnes, now positioned behind the President, notices two alert soldiers stationed on the rooftop. President Ashton ascends the red-carpeted steps to mount a podium erected in the middle of the plaza, now filled with a vibrant, flag-waving crowd devoid of the earlier protesters. The balding man now approaches a lectern with purposeful strides. Barnes and Taylor stride confidently across the podium, positioning themselves to face the sea of yellow and red flags. Amongst the crowd, a sizable man in a blue and white checked shirt stands out. He holds a video camera, filming the proceedings. Barnes's attention is suddenly caught by a curtain twitching on an upper floor. Taylor follows Barnes' gaze, observing the same movement. Just as Barnes prepares to speak into the microphone concealed in his cuff, he pauses. His eyes remain fixed intently on the suspect window and the fluttering curtain. He speaks clearly into his mic, communicating the observation. Taylor and Barnes exchange a meaningful look. Barnes notices the man in the checked shirt directing his camera towards the upper floors behind him, exactly where Barnes had seen the mysterious curtain fluttering moments before. The man then turns back around, meticulously checking his camera.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With a sense of unwavering confidence, he strides briskly over to the elevator and, with a decisive motion, presses the Call button to summon it to his floor. With a swift tap on his earpiece, he steps into the elevator. As he makes his way out of the elevator at his destination, he picks up the familiar voices of his well-known colleagues, Holden and Matthews, who are accompanied by Taylor. Without breaking his stride, Barnes passes them purposefully. Taylor, however, quickly follows him, and together they proceed towards a waiting vehicle. Shortly after their departure, they head towards the assembled cars as President Ashton, too, emerges from the elevator. The President approaches with deliberate steps and enters the car where Barnes and Taylor are standing by attentively. They follow him into the waiting vehicle, joining him inside. The convoy, led by two powerful motorcycles that roar to life, begins its journey from the underground garage. Trailing immediately behind the motorcycles is a police car, which is followed by two rugged four-by-four vehicles with their tailgates conspicuously open. Then, two sleek stretch limousines come closely behind, with additional vehicles bringing up the rear of the procession. Along the designated route, armed police officers with watchful eyes line the way, while other armed men in uniform are strategically positioned on rooftops and behind sturdy barred gates. Inside the presidential limousine, Taylor flashes a quick grin. Outside, protesters display an increasing rowdiness as the motorcade rolls smoothly past them. The convoy eventually comes to a halt next to a prominent statue of Pizarro located in Spain. At this moment, Secret Service agents efficiently spill out of the vehicles like clockwork. When the car door is opened, Taylor and Barnes step out promptly. With a scowl etched onto his narrow, permanently grim face, Barnes surveys the eager press photographers. He deliberately turns away from the intrusive cameras, taking a detour around the car to rejoin Taylor and the President. With determination, Taylor and Barnes lead the way forward, with the President following closely behind them. Holden and Matthews form a close rear guard, bringing up the tail end of the formation. As they progress towards the bustling plaza, Taylor casts a sideways glance at Barnes. The group emerges through an imposing archway into the lively, crowded plaza. Displaying confidence, the President strides towards a mother tenderly holding her child and shakes the baby's tiny hand. He acknowledges the enthusiastic, flag-waving crowd, warmly grasping hands as he progresses. Barnes's sharp eyes spot a suspicious man wearing dark glasses, who slyly slips his hand into an inside pocket. Suddenly, the man's camera tumbles to the ground. The presidential party continues on their path, with Holden seamlessly taking Barnes's position at the forefront. Barnes, now positioned directly behind the President, notices two alert soldiers stationed on a nearby rooftop. President Ashton ascends the red-carpeted steps to mount a podium erected centrally in the plaza, now filled with a vibrant, flag-waving crowd devoid of the earlier protesters. A balding man strides with purpose and approaches a lectern. Barnes and Taylor walk confidently across the podium, positioning themselves to face the sea of yellow and red flags. Amongst the crowd, a sizable man in a blue and white checked shirt distinctly stands out. He holds a video camera, carefully filming the proceedings. Barnes's attention is abruptly captured by a curtain twitching on an upper floor. Taylor follows Barnes's gaze, observing the same subtle movement. Just as Barnes prepares to speak into the microphone concealed in his cuff, he pauses. His eyes remain fixed intently on the suspicious window and the fluttering curtain. He speaks clearly into his mic, communicating the observation. Taylor and Barnes exchange a meaningful, understanding look. Barnes notices the man in the checked shirt directing his camera towards the upper floors behind him, exactly where Barnes had seen the mysterious curtain fluttering moments before. The man then turns back around, meticulously checking his camera settings.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He strides confidently towards the elevator, extending his finger to press the Call button, listening to the mechanical sound of the elevator descending. As it arrives, he simultaneously presses his earpiece, securing it in place with a slight touch of his fingertips, before stepping inside the metal confines of the elevator. The sliding doors close with a soft whoosh, enveloping him in solitude until he reaches his designated floor. As the doors part, he emerges into the corridor and catches the familiar voices of his colleagues, Holden and Matthews, engaged in conversation with Taylor. Without breaking stride, Barnes moves past them with purpose, drawing Taylor to follow him towards the waiting vehicles. They proceed together, their footsteps echoing in unison, as President Ashton appears from the elevator, a commanding presence that draws their attention. Barnes and Taylor stand respectfully beside the car as the President approaches, and as he settles into the vehicle, they seamlessly follow him inside, taking their designated positions. The convoy, led by two sleek motorcycles, roars to life, creating a symphony of engines resonating through the underground garage. The police car positions itself directly behind the motorcycles, its presence a signal of authority, while two four-by-fours trail with their tailgates jutting open, ready for action. As the procession continues, two stretch limousines glide smoothly, flanked by additional security vehicles that complete the convoy formation. Armed police officers vigilantly line the route, their eyes scanning the surroundings, while armed men in uniform stand sentinel on rooftops and behind secured gates, their shadows cast long in the sunlight. Inside the Presidential limo, Taylor's face breaks into a grin, a gesture that seems almost out of place in the tense atmosphere. As the motorcade advances, protesters on the streets grow increasingly rowdy, their shouts mingling with the engine noise as the convoy navigates past them. Abruptly, the convoy halts beside a statue of Pizarro in the heart of Spain, where Secret Service agents efficiently exit their vehicles, spilling into organized positions. With a firm motion, a car door is swung open, and Barnes climbs out alongside Taylor, his features molded into a permanent scowl as he scrutinizes the press photographers, aware of their every movement. Despite the grim demeanor etched into his narrow face, he turns away from the cameras, stepping around the car to rejoin Taylor and the President. Side by side, Taylor and Barnes take the lead, their footsteps deliberate and measured, with the President following in their wake. Holden and Matthews dutifully bring up the rear, ensuring no gaps in the protective formation as they proceed towards the plaza. Taylor's eyes flicker towards Barnes as they march forward, a silent communication passing between them. Emerging through the archway, they find themselves in a bustling plaza filled with people, the crowd dense and animated. The President strides with confidence toward a mother cradling her child, extending a hand to shake the baby's tiny fist in a gesture that humanizes his stately role. He then turns to the flag-waving crowd, clasping hands and sharing greetings as he moves amongst them with practiced ease. Amidst the vibrant scene, Barnes' observant gaze catches sight of a man wearing dark glasses, stealthily slipping a hand into an inside pocket. The man's camera slips from its perch, falling unceremoniously to the ground, yet the presidential procession continues unfazed, with Holden smoothly replacing Barnes at the forefront of the entourage. Now positioned behind the President, Barnes' eyes remain vigilant as they scan the area, aware of two soldiers stationed on a rooftop, their figures a reassuring presence. The President ascends the red-carpeted steps that lead to a podium strategically placed in the plaza's center, where the air is alive with the colors of waving flags and the sounds of cheering, momentarily free from dissenters. A balding man approaches a lectern, poised to address the gathered crowd. Barnes and Taylor stride across the podium with purpose, aligning themselves to face the vibrant sea of yellow and red flags, their stances alert yet composed. Within the throng is a robust man clad in a blue and white checked shirt, a video camera clutched in his hands, recording the unfolding events. Barnes' sharp gaze catches the subtle movement of a curtain twitching on an upper floor, prompting Taylor to trace his line of sight, understanding the unspoken signal. Barnes prepares to speak into the microphone embedded in his cuff but hesitates, his focus unwaveringly fixed on the window where the fabric rippled. Decisively, he speaks into the mic, his voice conveying urgency as Taylor and he share a meaningful glance. Alert and informed, Barnes watches as the man in the checked shirt swings his camera towards the upper floors, capturing the very spot where the curtain had trembled. Once satisfied, the man turns back to his surroundings, quickly checking his camera to ensure its readiness for whatever may unfold next.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Barnes strides to the elevator, presses the call button, and uses his earpiece as he enters. Exiting the elevator, he moves past colleagues Holden, Matthews, and Taylor, who follows him to a car. As President Ashton emerges and gets into the car by Barnes and Taylor, they accompany him. The convoy, led by motorcycles and a police car, sets off from the garage, flanked by four-by-fours and limos, with armed officers lining the route and stationed on rooftops and behind gates. Inside the limo, Taylor grins as protesters become rowdy. The motorcade halts by a statue in Spain, where Secret Service agents disembark. Barnes scans the press grimly before joining Taylor and the President. The group, with Barnes and Taylor leading and Holden and Matthews behind, proceeds to a plaza. Emerging through an archway, the President greets a child and the flag-waving crowd. Barnes notices a man in dark glasses reaching into his pocket, the man's camera falling as the party continues, with Holden replacing Barnes at the front. Climbing red-carpeted steps, the President addresses a cheering crowd. Barnes and Taylor scan the crowd from the podium, where Barnes notices a curtain twitching on an upper floor. As Barnes goes to speak into his cuff mic, he stops, then exchanges a look with Taylor. Both observe a man in a checked shirt pointing a camera at the upper floors.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description:
He strides to the elevator and presses the Call button, one of the many recent technological upgrades in the modernized office building. He presses his earpiece, a device connected to a secure communication network used by security teams, and enters the elevator. As he exits, he hears two other colleagues, Holden and Matthews, both seasoned members of the security detail, with Taylor. Barnes, a veteran agent known for his meticulous nature, strides past them. Taylor follows him to a car, specifically equipped with advanced security features. They all move to cars as President Ashton, the recently elected leader known for his diplomatic strategies, emerges from the elevator. The President gets into the car by which Barnes and Taylor are standing. They follow him in. 

The convoy, headed by the two motorcycles driven by highly trained police escorts, sets off from the underground garage of the governmental building. Behind the motorcycles is a police car, then two four-by-fours with their tailgates open to allow quick deployment of security personnel. Then two stretch limos, part of the official fleet used for state events, with more vehicles bringing up the rear. Armed police line the route, a common sight in high-security operations. Armed men in uniform are on rooftops and behind barred gates to monitor for any potential threat. In the Presidential limo, Taylor grins, confident in their security protocol. Protesters grow rowdy as the motorcade passes them, reflecting the tense political climate. The convoy stops by a statue of Pizarro at Spain, a historical monument commemorating the Spanish conquistador. The Secret Service agents spill out with practiced precision. His car door is opened. Taylor and Barnes climb up. Barnes scowls as he scans the press photographers, wary of any suspicious activity. His narrow face is permanently grim as he turns from the cameras and walks around the car to join Taylor and the President. Taylor and Barnes lead the way, maintaining tight security. The President is behind them. Holden and Matthews bring up the rear, ensuring all angles are covered. Taylor glances across at Barnes as the group makes their way to the plaza, aware of the importance of their alertness in such a crowded space.

They emerge through an archway of the crowded plaza, a public square known for hosting significant events. The President strides towards a child in its mother's arms, performing the age-old gesture of connecting with citizens. He shakes the baby's hand. He greets the flag-waving crowd, grasping hands as he passes, an image of political charisma. Barnes spots a man wearing dark glasses slip his hand into an inside pocket. The man's camera drops to the ground, causing a momentary disruption. The presidential party continues, Holden replacing Barnes at the front, part of their coordinated security rotation. Barnes now behind the President, ensuring no lapse in protection. Two soldiers on the roof, part of an enhanced security measure. President Ashton climbs red-carpeted steps onto a podium placed in the middle of the plaza, which is filled with a flag-waving, cheering crowd free from protesters. The balding man now walks to a lectern, prepared for the upcoming speech. Barnes and Taylor stride across the podium and stand facing out towards the sea of yellow and red flags, the national colors creating a vibrant display.

Standing amongst the crowd is a chunky man in a blue and white checked shirt. He holds a video camera, likely recording the event for documentation or media purposes. Barnes notices a curtain twitch on an upper floor of a nearby building, a potential indication of surveillance. Taylor follows Barnes' gaze, understanding the implications of such movements. Barnes goes to speak into a mic integrated into his cuff, designed for discreet communication, but stops. Barnes' eyes are fixed on the window and the curtain, alert to the slightest signs of danger. He speaks into his mic with urgency. Taylor and Barnes exchange a look, communicating silently with the efficiency born from years of working together. Barnes sees the man in the checked shirt pointing his camera at the upper floors behind him to where Barnes saw the fluttering curtain, a visual confirmation of possible activity. The man turns back around checking his camera, seemingly oblivious to the security concerns.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: He strides to the elevator and presses the Call button. He presses his earpiece and enters the elevator. As he exits he hears two other colleagues Holden and Matthews with Taylor. Barnes strides past them. Taylor follows him to a car. They all move to cars as President Ashton emerges from the elevator. The President gets into the car by which Barnes and Taylor are standing. They follow him in. The convoy headed by the two motorcycles sets off from the underground garage. Behind the motorcycles is a police car then two fourbyfours with their tailgates open. Then two stretch limos with more vehicles bringing up the rear. Armed police line the route. Armed men in uniform are on rooftops and behind barred gates. In the Presidential limo Taylor grins. Protesters grow rowdy as the motorcade passes them. The convoy stops by a statue of Pizarro at Spain. The Secret Service agents spill out. His car door is opened. Taylor and Barnes climb up. Barnes scowls as he scans the press photographers. His narrow face is permanently grim as he turns from the cameras and walks around the car to join Taylor and the President. Taylor and Barnes lead the way. The President is behind them. Holden and Matthews bring up the rear. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Taylor glances across at Barnes as the group makes their way to the plaza. They emerge through an archway of the crowded plaza. The President strides towards a child in its mother's arms. He shakes the baby's hand. He greets the flagwaving crowd grasping hands as he passes. Barnes spots a man wearing dark glasses slip his hand into an inside pocket. The man's camera drops to the ground. The presidential party continues. Holden replacing Barnes at the front. Barnes now behind the President. Two soldiers on the roof. President Ashton climbs redcarpeted steps onto a podium placed in the middle of the plaza which is filled with a flagwaving cheering crowd free from protesters. The balding man now walks to a lectern. Barnes and Taylor stride across the podium and stand facing out towards the sea of yellow and red flags. Standing amongst the crowd is a chunky man in a blue and white checked shirt. He holds a video camera. Barnes notices a curtain twitch on an upper floor. Taylor follows Barnes' gaze. Barnes goes to speak into a mic in his cuff but stops. Barnes' eyes are fixed on the window and the curtain. He speaks into his mic. Taylor and Barnes exchange a look. Barnes sees the man in the checked shirt pointing his camera at the upper floors behind him to where Barnes saw the fluttering curtain. The man turns back around checking his camera.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: He strides to the elevator and presses the Call button. He presses his earpiece and enters the elevator. As he exits he hears two other colleagues Holden and Matthews with Taylor. Barnes strides past them. Taylor follows him to a car. They all move to cars as President Ashton emerges from the elevator. The President gets into the car by which Barnes and Taylor are standing. They follow him in. The convoy headed by the two motorcycles sets off from the underground garage. Behind the motorcycles is a police car then two fourbyfours with their tailgates open. Then two stretch limos with more vehicles bringing up the rear. Armed police line the route. Armed men in uniform are on rooftops and behind barred gates. In the Presidential limo Taylor grins. Protesters grow rowdy as the motorcade passes them. The convoy stops by a statue of Pizarro at Spain. The Secret Service agents spill out. His car door is opened. Taylor and Barnes climb up. Barnes scowls as he scans the press photographers. His narrow face is permanently grim as he turns from the cameras and walks around the car to join Taylor and the President. Taylor and Barnes lead the way. The President is behind them. Holden and Matthews bring up the rear. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. test_cases.description: He strides to the elevator and presses the Call button. He presses his earpiece and enters the elevator. As he exits he hears two other colleagues Holden and Matthews with Taylor. Barnes strides past them. Taylor follows him to a car. Barnes' eyes are fixed on the window and the curtain. He speaks into his mic. Taylor and Barnes exchange a look. Barnes sees the man in the checked shirt pointing his camera at the upper floors behind him to where Barnes saw the fluttering curtain. The man turns back around checking his camera.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The giraffe strides to the elevator and presses the Call button. The giraffe presses its earpiece and enters the elevator. As the giraffe exits, it hears two other colleagues, Thompson and Edwards, with Jackson. The wolf strides past them. Jackson follows the wolf to a car. They all move to cars as Chancellor Martinez emerges from the elevator. The Chancellor gets into the car by which the wolf and Jackson are standing. They follow the Chancellor in. The convoy, headed by the two horses, sets off from the underground garage. Behind the horses is a fire truck, then two four-by-fours with their tailgates open. Then two stretch limos with more vehicles bringing up the rear. Armed firefighters line the route. Armed penguins in uniform are on rooftops and behind barred gates. In the Presidential limo, Jackson grins. Protesters grow rowdy as the motorcade passes them. The convoy stops by a statue of Cervantes at Spain. The Secret Service agents spill out. Its car door is opened. Jackson and the wolf climb up. The wolf scowls as it scans the press photographers. Its narrow face is permanently grim as it turns from the cameras and walks around the car to join Jackson and the Chancellor. Jackson and the wolf lead the way. The Chancellor is behind them. Thompson and Edwards bring up the rear. Jackson glances across at the wolf as the group makes their way to the plaza. They emerge through an archway of the crowded plaza. The Chancellor strides towards a child in its mother's arms. The Chancellor shakes the baby's hand. The Chancellor greets the flag-waving crowd, grasping hands as the Chancellor passes. The wolf spots a man wearing dark glasses slip his hand into an inside pocket. The man's camera drops to the ground. The presidential party continues, Thompson replacing the wolf at the front. The wolf now behind the Chancellor. Two zebras on the roof. Chancellor Martinez climbs red-carpeted steps onto a podium placed in the middle of the plaza, which is filled with a flag-waving, cheering crowd free from protesters. The bald eagle now walks to a lectern. The wolf and Jackson stride across the podium and stand facing out towards the sea of yellow and red flags. Standing amongst the crowd is a chunky kangaroo in a blue and white checked shirt. The kangaroo holds a video camera. The wolf notices a curtain twitch on an upper floor. Jackson follows the wolf's gaze. The wolf goes to speak into a mic in its cuff, but stops. The wolf's eyes are fixed on the window and the curtain. The wolf speaks into its mic. Jackson and the wolf exchange a look. The wolf sees the kangaroo in the checked shirt pointing its camera at the upper floors behind it to where the wolf saw the fluttering curtain. The kangaroo turns back around checking its camera.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: He strides to the escalator and presses the Lantern button. He adjusts his wristwatch and enters the escalator. As he exits, he hears two other colleagues, Holden and Matthews, with Taylor. Barnes strides past them. Taylor follows him to a skateboard. They all move to skateboards as President Ashton emerges from the escalator. The President gets onto the skateboard by which Barnes and Taylor are standing. They follow him in. The convoy, headed by the two bicycles, sets off from the underground tunnel. Behind the bicycles is a taxi, then two sedans with their trunks open. Then two pickup trucks with more vehicles bringing up the rear. Armed firefighters line the route. Armed men in uniform are on balconies and behind chain-link fences. In the Presidential truck, Taylor grins. Spectators grow rowdy as the parade passes them. The convoy stops by a sculpture of Newton at Portugal. The Secret Service agents spill out. His skateboard is wheeled out. Taylor and Barnes climb up. Barnes scowls as he scans the street artists. His narrow face is permanently grim as he turns from the onlookers and walks around the skateboard to join Taylor and the President. Taylor and Barnes lead the way. The President is behind them. Holden and Matthews bring up the rear. Taylor glances across at Barnes as the group makes their way to the arena. They emerge through an archway of the crowded arena. The President strides towards a puppy in its owner's arms. He pats the puppy's head. He greets the balloon-waving audience, grasping hands as he passes. Barnes spots a man wearing a baseball cap slip his hand into an inside pocket. The man's binoculars drop to the ground. The presidential party continues, Holden replacing Barnes at the front. Barnes now behind the President. Two firefighters on the balcony. President Ashton climbs blue-carpeted steps onto a platform placed in the middle of the arena, which is filled with a balloon-waving, cheering audience free from spectators. The balding man now walks to a small table. Barnes and Taylor stride across the platform and stand facing out towards the sea of green and orange balloons. Standing amongst the audience is a lanky man in a red and white striped shirt. He holds a digital camera. Barnes notices a curtain twitch on an upper floor. Taylor follows Barnes' gaze. Barnes goes to speak into a speaker in his collar, but stops. Barnes' eyes are fixed on the window and the curtain. He speaks into his wristwatch. Taylor and Barnes exchange a look. Barnes sees the man in the striped shirt pointing his camera at the upper floors behind him to where Barnes saw the fluttering curtain. The man turns back around checking his camera.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He skips to the elevator and taps the Call button. He taps his earpiece and enters the elevator. As he departs, he overhears two other colleagues, Holden and Matthews, with Taylor. Barnes skips past them. Taylor joins him to a car. They all navigate to cars as President Ashton appears from the elevator. The President hops into the car by which Barnes and Taylor are lingering. They accompany him in. The convoy, led by the two motorcycles, rolls out from the underground garage. Trailing the motorcycles is a police car, followed by two four-by-fours with their tailgates ajar. Then two stretch limos with additional vehicles closing the line. Armed police patrol the route. Armed soldiers in uniform stand on rooftops and behind locked gates. In the Presidential limo, Taylor smiles. Protesters grow animated as the motorcade rolls past them. The convoy halts by a statue of Pizarro at Spain. The Secret Service agents pour out. His car door is held open. Taylor and Barnes ascend. Barnes frowns as he inspects the press photographers. His narrow face is permanently stern as he pivots from the cameras and strolls around the car to join Taylor and the President. Taylor and Barnes guide the way. The President trails them. Holden and Matthews close the procession. Taylor peers across at Barnes as the group progresses to the plaza. They arrive through an archway of the crowded plaza. The President ambles towards a child in its mother's arms. He pats the baby's hand. He acknowledges the flag-waving crowd, holding hands as he strolls by. Barnes observes a man wearing dark glasses slide his hand into an internal pocket. The man's camera topples to the ground. The presidential party advances, Holden taking Barnes' position at the front. Barnes now behind the President. Two soldiers on the roof. President Ashton climbs crimson-carpeted steps onto a podium positioned in the center of the plaza, filled with a flag-waving, cheering crowd absent of protesters. The balding man now advances to a lectern. Barnes and Taylor march across the podium and stand gazing out towards the sea of yellow and red flags. Standing amidst the crowd is a stocky man in a blue and white checked shirt. He grips a video camera. Barnes spots a curtain quiver on an upper floor. Taylor follows Barnes' gaze. Barnes attempts to speak into a mic in his cuff, but hesitates. Barnes' eyes remain on the window and the curtain. He communicates into his mic. Taylor and Barnes share a look. Barnes observes the man in the checked shirt aiming his camera at the upper floors behind him to where Barnes noticed the fluttering curtain. The man spins back around examining his camera.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The giraffe glides to the trampoline and taps the Launch lever. The giraffe taps its necklace and enters the trampoline. As it exits, it hears two other dolphins, Liberty and Jefferson, with Kennedy. Lincoln glides past them. Kennedy follows it to a bicycle. They all move to bicycles as Emperor Picasso emerges from the trampoline. The Emperor gets into the bicycle by which Lincoln and Kennedy are standing. They follow it in. The parade, led by the two roller skates, sets off from the underwater cave. Behind the roller skates is a fire truck, then two kayaks with their oars open. Then two hot air balloons with more spaceships bringing up the rear. Clownfish line the route. Clownfish in costume are on balconies and behind iron fences. In the Emperor’s hot air balloon, Kennedy smirks. Spectators grow rowdy as the cavalcade passes them. The parade stops by a sculpture of Columbus at Italy. The ninja turtles spill out. Its bicycle door is swung. Kennedy and Lincoln climb up. Lincoln frowns as it scans the painters. Its narrow face is permanently stern as it turns from the mirrors and walks around the bicycle to join Kennedy and the Emperor. Kennedy and Lincoln lead the way. The Emperor is behind them. Liberty and Jefferson bring up the rear. Kennedy glances across at Lincoln as the herd makes its way to the temple. They emerge through an alley of the crowded temple. The Emperor glides towards a puppy in its father’s arms. It shakes the puppy's paw. It greets the hat-waving audience, grasping paws as it passes. Lincoln spots an elf wearing light goggles slip its paw into an outer pocket. The elf’s megaphone drops to the sand. The Emperor’s entourage continues, Liberty replacing Lincoln at the helm. Lincoln now behind the Emperor. Two penguins on the rooftop. Emperor Picasso climbs velvet-coated steps onto a boulder placed in the core of the temple, which is filled with a hat-waving, cheering audience free from hecklers. The feathered elf now walks to a podium. Lincoln and Kennedy glide across the boulder and stand facing out towards the ocean of green and blue banners. Standing amongst the audience is a slender elf in a red and black striped cape. It holds a rainbow camera. Lincoln notices a curtain ripple on a lower deck. Kennedy follows Lincoln’s stare. Lincoln goes to speak into a mic in its sock, but pauses. Lincoln’s eyes are glued to the hatch and the curtain. It speaks into its mic. Kennedy and Lincoln exchange a glance. Lincoln sees the elf in the striped cape aiming its camera at the lower decks behind it to where Lincoln noticed the rippling curtain. The elf pivots back around, checking its camera.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: She hops to the stairwell and taps the Call button. She adjusts her necklace and enters the stairwell. As she ascends, she observes two other neighbors, Clarkson and Daniels, with Morgan. Evans hops past them. Morgan runs after her to a scooter. They all glide to scooters as Manager Brown emerges from the stairwell. The Manager climbs into the scooter where Evans and Morgan are standing. They trail behind her. The cavalcade, led by two bicycles, rolls out from the underground tunnel. Behind the bicycles is a fire truck, then two motorbikes with their saddlebags open. Then two sedans with more vehicles closing the procession. Alert guards line the path. Uniformed figures are on balconies and behind closed fences. In the Manager's sedan, Morgan chuckles. Onlookers grow boisterous as the procession moves past them. The cavalcade halts by a monument of Columbus in Madrid. The security personnel pour out. Her scooter door is opened. Morgan and Evans mount up. Evans frowns as she inspects the news crews. Her slender face is permanently stern as she turns from the cameras and circles the scooter to join Morgan and the Manager. Morgan and Evans lead the way. The Manager trails behind them. Clarkson and Daniels bring up the back. Morgan glances over at Evans as the group heads toward the square. They appear through an entryway of the bustling square. The Manager strides towards a child in its parent's arms. She tickles the toddler’s hand. She acknowledges the jubilant crowd, grasping hands as she proceeds. Evans notices a woman wearing a wide-brimmed hat slip her hand into an outer pocket. The woman's notebook drops to the ground. The executive team proceeds, Clarkson supplanting Evans at the forefront. Evans now lags behind the Manager. Two firefighters on the balcony. Manager Brown climbs the blue-carpeted stairs onto a platform erected in the heart of the square, which is packed with a jubilant, cheering crowd, free from onlookers. The bespectacled woman now strides to a podium. Evans and Morgan hop across the platform and stand facing out towards the sea of blue and white flags. Standing amongst the crowd is a lanky man in a green and orange striped suit. He clutches a still camera. Evans observes a curtain shift on a lower level. Morgan follows Evans' gaze. Evans goes to whisper into a pen in her blazer, but pauses. Evans' eyes are locked on the balcony and the curtain. She whispers into her pen. Morgan and Evans share a glance. Evans sees the man in the striped suit directing his camera at the lower levels behind her to where Evans saw the twitching curtain. The man swivels back around adjusting his camera.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He marches to the staircase and taps the Door button. He adjusts his headphones and climbs the staircase. As he enters, he notices two other colleagues, Holden and Matthews, with Taylor. Barnes marches past them. Taylor tags along with him to a taxi. They all drift to taxis as President Ashton bounces from the staircase. The President climbs into the taxi by which Barnes and Taylor are leaning. They trail behind him in. The procession, led by two scooters, rolls out from the basement parking. Following the scooters is a fire truck, then two campers with their rear hatches closed. Then two double-decker buses with additional vehicles trailing. Armed guards flank the street. Armed individuals in suits occupy balconies and behind metal grates. In the Presidential bus, Taylor beams. Onlookers become boisterous as the procession rolls past them. The procession halts by a fountain of Neptune in Italy. The Secret Service officers pour out. His taxi door is opened. Taylor and Barnes clamber up. Barnes frowns as he sweeps the crowd of reporters. His elongated expression remains sour as he turns away from the cameras and circles the taxi to join Taylor and the President. Taylor and Barnes pave the path. The President trails them. Holden and Matthews conclude the line. Taylor peeks over at Barnes as the assembly advances towards the square. They emerge through a tunnel of the congested square. The President heads towards a toddler in its father's embrace. He tickles the toddler's fingers. He acknowledges the banner-waving throng, grasping arms as he proceeds. Barnes catches sight of a person sporting clear spectacles navigate his hand into an outer bag. The person’s balloon floats to the pavement. The presidential gathering proceeds, Holden taking Barnes' place at the forefront. Barnes now lags behind the President. Two officers perched on the tower. President Ashton scales velvet-carpeted stairs onto a stage situated in the heart of the square, which is brimming with a banner-waving, applauding crowd void of onlookers. The grey-haired individual now strolls to a table. Barnes and Taylor march across the stage and stand facing outward towards the ocean of green and white banners. Standing amidst the throng is a husky man in a striped red and green jersey. He holds a digital recorder. Barnes observes a shutter flicker on an upper terrace. Taylor follows Barnes' sightline. Barnes attempts to whisper into a speaker on his wrist, but pauses. Barnes' focus is glued to the terrace and the shutter. He mutters into his speaker. Taylor and Barnes share a glance. Barnes notices the man in the striped jersey aiming his recorder at the upper terraces behind him to where Barnes observed the flickering shutter. The man pivots back, inspecting his recorder.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The penguin waddles to the haystack and taps the Sing button. The penguin taps its monocle and hops into the haystack. As it enters, it smells two other zebras, Watson and Lincoln, with Fern. Daisy waddles beside them. Fern trails it to a submarine. They all drift to submarines as Emperor Wellington surfaces from the haystack. The Emperor climbs into the submarine by which Daisy and Fern are lounging. They join it inside. The procession, led by the two sailboats, drifts away from the subterranean lagoon. After the sailboats is a school bus, followed by two skateboards with their wheels spinning. Then two blimps with more spacecraft trailing behind. Masked dancers line the path. Camouflaged figures in disguise are on treetops and behind iron fences. In the Emperor's blimp, Fern smirks. Bystanders grow playful as the flotilla floats past them. The procession halts by a statue of a Dragon at Atlantis. The undercover chefs tumble out. Its hatch is lifted. Fern and Daisy climb down. Daisy frowns as it inspects the gathering illustrators. Its angular snout is permanently sour as it shifts from the lenses and bounces around the submarine to join Fern and the Emperor. Fern and Daisy pave the trail. The Emperor sails behind them. Watson and Lincoln trail the end. Fern peers over at Daisy as the troupe glides to the oceanfront. They appear through a gateway of the bustling oceanfront. The Emperor hops towards a kitten in its father's scarf. It pats the kitten's paw. It hails the balloon-waving assembly, clutching paws as it floats by. Daisy notices a woman wearing bright earrings tuck her paw into a large handbag. The woman's lantern topples to the sand. The emperor's crew proceeds, Watson succeeding Daisy at the helm. Daisy now behind the Emperor. Two sailors on the lighthouse. Emperor Wellington climbs golden stairs onto a platform situated in the heart of the oceanfront, which is adorned with balloon-waving, applauding spectators absent of grumblers. The bearded woman now waltzes to a pulpit. Daisy and Fern prance across the platform and stand peering out towards the ocean of blue and green balloons. Standing in the assembly is a slender woman in a red and yellow striped blouse. She grips a disposable camera. Daisy detects a drape flicker on an upper balcony. Fern echoes Daisy's observation. Daisy prepares to murmur into a whistle in its hat, but halts. Daisy's eyes are locked on the balcony and the drape. It whispers into its whistle. Fern and Daisy share a glance. Daisy observes the woman in the striped blouse aiming her camera at the upper balconies behind her to where Daisy noticed the rustling drape. The woman rotates back around, adjusting her camera.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Barnes strides to the elevator with his earpiece, accompanied by Taylor, Holden, and Matthews. President Ashton joins them, and they enter a convoy led by motorcycles, police cars, and stretch limos from the underground garage. The route is secured by armed police as protesters energize when the motorcade passes. The convoy halts at a statue in Spain, where Secret Service agents, including Taylor and Barnes, escort the President through a plaza filled with supporters. Barnes spots a suspicious man with dark glasses, but the group moves on. The President ascends a podium, greeted by flags and cheers. Barnes notices a curtain twitch on an upper window and alerts Taylor. They exchange a look as a man in a checked shirt films the upper floors, possibly linked to the curtain movement.

curtain Taylor and Barnes exchange a look He speaks into his mic Barnes' eyes are fixed on the window and the curtain Barnes goes to speak into a mic in his cuff but stops Taylor follows Barnes' gaze stand facing out towards the sea of yellow and red flags The balding man now walks to a lectern President Ashton climbs redcarpeted steps onto a podium placed in the middle of the plaza which is
